info.label: Full Stack Developer
info.brief: Full-Stack developer, with 8+ years of experience. I live by a simple principle, 'leave it better than you found it'. I'm comfortable with wearing a lot of hats; whether includes greenfield development, jumping in to lead a team, implementing new techologies, interfacing with customers. I adapt to the domain and needs of business.

history.summary: Acted as the sole West Coast Field Service Representative for MARCORSYSCOM Combat Camera. Providing, logistics tracking/support of the tactical systems including the TIPS (Tactical Imagery Production System) deployable.
highlights: Fielded, tracked, and supported $5+ million in military hardware
Supported 11 units across 6 military installations
Technical SME for the TIPS (Tactical Imagery Production System)
Acted as the onsite technical SME for 2 tactical field exercises
Led semi-annual field traning events for the TIPS
Certified Xerox MFD field technician
Setup and trained a non-technical team on the use of S3
Authored automation tools for Excel->PDF form filling
Website redesign to use dynamic templating w/ a custom static html compliler

history.summary: Hacking on commercial full flight simulators for fun and profit.
highlights: Designed and imlemented various avionics and aircraft systems updates
Full Stack development of a website + database backend using HTML/CSS/JS/PHP/MySQL
Product design/architecture/development (full lifecycle) of a turnkey system
Custom networking protocol design and implementation

history.summary: I worked as a technician building avionics cabling, populating instrument panels, hooking up I/O, and calibrating the systems post installation.

projects.title: node-ftpsync
highlights: One-command incremental synchronization
Published to NPM
Grunt plugin (grunt-ftpsync) available

projects.title: jquery-csv
projects.summary: The first RFC 4180 complete parser for Javascript
highlights: 500K+ downloads
Published to Bower
First RFC 4180 compliant lexer/parser implementation for JS
First implementation of a hand-rolled, DFA, single-pass parser.

projects.title: Replacement Instructor Operating Station
projects.summary: A multi-touchscreen interface for commercial flight simulators.
highlights: First full lifecycle greenfield product development
250K in revenue
Architect of all systems, components, IPC, and network communications
Specified and built all custom hardware incl hot/cold spare redundancy
First turnkey hardware product implementation
Successful acceptance - 90 days @ 99.9% uptime

recognition.title: Commendation for Exemplary Performance
recognition.summary: Acted as the onsite technical SME to support and assist with the first deployment of the Tactical Imagery Production System V3.0. The exercise 'Desert Scimitar 14' took place in the Mojave Desert near 29 Palms.
